pullrequest.title: Auto MEX files generation using MATLAB

content.raw:
I don't think so. Mex compilation is really using the Visual Studio configuration (vcvarsall) which can cross-compile to desired bitnness.

Which is true, it that a 32 bits MATLAB could be installed under `Program Files x86` in a Windows 64 bits. I'm inclined to hack a detection mechanism in the future if we find the need of it.
content.html:
I don't think so. Mex compilation is really using the Visual Studio configuration (vcvarsall) which can cross-compile to desired bitnness.

Which is true, it that a 32 bits MATLAB could be installed under Program Files x86 in a Windows 64 bits. I'm inclined to hack a detection mechanism in the future if we find the need of it.
